meanings.sent1: I will reinspect the car to make sure it is safe to drive.
meanings.sent2: The detective decided to reinspect the crime scene for any missed clues.
meanings.sent3: I had to reinspect my messy room before my mom would let me go out to play.
meanings.sent4: She had to reinspect her decision before making a final choice.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to reinspect their answers for any errors.

meanings.definition: To look at or examine something again.
meanings.sent1: Please reinspect the document to ensure all the information is correct.
meanings.sent2: The scientist needed to reinspect the data to confirm the results.
meanings.sent3: I had to reinspect the recipe to figure out why my cake didn't turn out right.
meanings.sent4: He had to reinspect his assumptions before presenting his findings.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic will reinspect the engine to find the source of the problem.
